intro: Thereianthus intermedius, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy texture and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil, making it a popular houseplant. Its ability to bloom year-round in suitable conditions adds to its ornamental value.
